snippet.textDisplay:
It'is fact that in high prevalence SC2 areas, the reinfection can be as short as 3 months, but those cases
are usually in environments where hospital staff is concerned.
They breathe in SC2 nearly daily in some cases, while in most cases their bodies start antibody production,
and simply never ceases. hence me thinking the continuous production of antibodies is a good strategy,
saying 5% vaccine shots (of current dosages) with updated vaccines will create a similar defence.
It would alo lower vaccine intake, which by itself is also a damaging process.
The damage by this should also be taken into account if the 'coexistence with SC2' would be another failed
but tried strategy. In the best case even this strategy would only lower the death toll, but any only
vaccnie strategy will lead to invariably to immune escape at rates that are phenomenal.
We seen people getting infected twice, and with the coming of teh third year of SC2,
the rates for triple infections will also go up, and after that quadruple etc...
